Skiing is the main activity of the Girona pyrenees. Big skiing resorts of La Molina and La Masella are near
. Smaller resorts are Vall de Núria in

.

The high season goes from christmas holidays to mid of march, including all weekends of March and easter holidays.

value: content=The ski resort La Masella goes from 1600 to 2535m altitude and has around 72 slopes with 70km in total.

content=The ski resort La Molina stretches from 1700 to 2445m above sea level and has approximately 60km of ski slopes including 17 red and 6 black ones. There is possibility to rent skis, snowboards or ski shoes from an Intersport shop. There is also a fun park with a slope and half-pipe.
directions=on the end of the Vall de Núria Rack Railway
content=Sky resort on the narural environment of Núria valley, the place of the Virgin of Núria sanctuary.

The Girona Pyrenees region has some Michelin-starred restaurants such as les Cols (2 stars) and Ca l'Enric (1 star) in
and Fonda Xesc (1 star) in Combrèn. Most restaurants in this touristic region serve traditional Catalan cuisine.
